title: terms_24.txt
terms:
Here are the extracted legal Terms and Conditions from the text:

*   “You should make clear what you are selling.”
*   “The price should include all variations and circumstances and provisions for increase.”
*   “Set out conditions under which you may change the purchase price, how you will tell your client about the change and whether it will affect this contract.”
*   “If you sell a service repeatedly, such as accounting or web hosting, you will need provision for periodic price increases.”
*   “It will be appropriate for your document to set out the circumstances of the increase and possibly to give notice of it in a way which enables the client to terminate if they do not wish to accept the new price.”
*   “You must agree to your terms to be bound to them.”
*   “The client must agree to your terms to be bound to them”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
*   “You must consider whether your clients are able to terminate if they do not wish to accept the new price.”
*    “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
*   “The contract must be agreed before the contract is made.”
